This won't be scalable. If the user uploads a new file there are two things we can do,

Validate the JSON and if it has all the right widget and attribute references
Set the output of step #1 to the state and allow the UI now re-render based on the state change.

Resolved.
Whenever the JSONStatus changes to success state, the UI will unmount and remount. This has been enabled by adding a loading state in https://github.com/cdapio/cdap/blob/86724e9a3695e559255c8c8ec7a1b97288dff6a0/cdap-ui/app/cdap/components/PluginJSONCreator/Create/Content/index.tsx
Please try to avoid this.
Resolved.
Is this intended?

I made a bit of change to improve this component's structure since this review. Now, the two components ClosedJsonMenu and JsonLiveViewer will share the <Drawer/> component, whereas before the review they had separate initializations of <Drawer/>.
With these new changes, it will make more sense for open to be set to true since either one of these two components is always open.
Resolved.
Would be worth checking if we can file-dnd on the entire page. The user might just have to drag and drop a valid plugin config and we show properties-widget view right away.
As per discussion yesterday, I will be adding this in a separate PR!
nit: Use LoadingSVG icon
I ended up removing the CircularProgress since we're now remounting component on file import, as per your suggestion from #12229 (comment)

This will give no time for the user to read the message, understand and process. The pattern we already have is to show the error message and allow the user to close the message. Success messages can be transient as they provide only confirmations and not information.
